biogs.title: Integrating geophysical data with geology - making consistent maps
biogs.information: Direct targeting from geophysical data should be a thing of the past!!! Although subjective, interpretations of geophysical data and integration with geological observations are an amazing tool to help decipher the geometry of a prospective belt, understand its structural evolution and map out potential dilation sites to help targetand discover new resources.

biogs.title: Learning objectives
biogs.information:
• Process regional geophysical datasets
• Develop strategies to interpret geology from regional aeromagnetic and gravity data
• Integrate geological data into the geophysical interpretation
• Practical experience in geophysical interpretation
biogs.sub_info: The course is designed to provide practical experience in the processing of regional geophysical datasets for the purpose of undertaking geological interpretation. The course schedule allows you to go through step-by-step methodologies of processing data and interpretation techniques while understanding the limitations of the data.

biogs.title: Assessment
biogs.information: You will demonstrate your understanding by producing
biogs.sub_info:
• a litho-structural interpretation
• a short report explaining how the map was constructed:
<> how the geophysical data were interpreted in terms of varying lithologies and
<> how structures and overprints were interpreted)

biogs.title: Resources and pre-requisites
biogs.information: You should have at least completed a mapping unit at 2nd or 3rd year level and/or a geology degree
biogs.sub_info:
Useful resources:
• Geology from aeromagnetic data 2024, Betts, Moore, Aitken, Blaikie, Jessell, Ailleres, Armit, McLean, Munukutla, Earth Science Reviews DOI
• Geological interpretation of aeromagnetic data 2018, D. Isles & L.R. Rankin, ASEG publication
• Gravity and Magnetic Exploration Principles, Practices and Applications, 2012, W.J. Hinze, R.R.B. von Frese, A.H. Saad, Cambridge University Press
